title: UDL-Based Mathematics Instructional Design Workshop for Deaf/Hard-of-Hearing Learners in K-12 Education

context.prior_knowledge: Grasp of elementary mathematical concepts, foundational teaching competencies as a prospective educator
context.additional_context: Awareness of basic accessibility requirements for understanding hearing-impaired learners in smartphone-centric, limited-technology environments

learning_goals: When designing math lessons for hearing-impaired learners, the three UDL principles (engagement, representation, action & expression) can be applied with over 80% fidelity.
Design and implement at least two types of accessible visual and verbal support materials via smartphones.
Develop at least one UDL-based formative assessment tool (e.g., instructional videos, visual checklists) to promote learner independence.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
